title: Examining My Permanent Ban
body:
**Edit3:** Over the past 9 hours, 77.65% of 340 people have voted that this punishment was not justified by my actions. I appreciate you voting, and I encourage you to read the pastebin link below. It contains the full chat logs for games 1-3.

**Edit2:** It seems the majority of people think this punishment is too harsh, although a punishment was needed. I have submitted a ticket explaining how I intend to correct my use of text chat in game, and I hope to have my account reinstated as a final chance. Wish me luck, and thank you all for the responses!

**Edit:** [Here is a pastebin](http://pastebin.com/ueasKhfj) of the entire chat log attached to my perma ban. In game 2 we got outscaled and tilted off the planet. Game 3 every lane and role got outplayed and the game was done, we all agreed to ff and our top lane left. When reading chat logs, you have to account for context and in which chat the message was sent. Telling your cocky 5/0 opponent that he is horrible is a lot different than saying the same to your 0/4 tilted adc.

 
I would like to get your opinion's on whether this is worthy of a permanent account suspension. The game was very evenly matched rank-wise (around diamond 3 MMR), however individual matchups were not. Our team had two players, me and my mid laner, who were on their experienced roles, while the enemy team had all five players on their main roles. In this game, all 3 lanes got absolutely crushed. 

My mid laner became increasingly toxic towards me and blaming me for the losing side lanes. My top laner (bot main) decided to play his second Riven game to-date, even taking the time to inform me of this fact right at the start. My adc was extremely toxic and negative throughout the game and refused to allow herself to be carried. My support ran the wrong runes/masteries. I tried my best to farm it out until late game, but come 20 minutes the game was just too toxic. We tried to surrender, and it failed 3-2. At that point, I was stuck in a lost game with unfocused, AFK, and openly toxic players until 28 minutes. As always, I tried my best until the nexus fell.

 

Should I have muted chat and shut up? Of course. But when my teammates flamed me, gave up, and then held me hostage for 8 minutes, there was no way to contain my frustration. The intent of a permanent ban is to permanently disable access to one's account, and remove them from the community forever. Was this punishment justified?

1. You only provided a single game. In reality, you were punished for multiple games, and 3 games were given in your reform card. You should post those games as well if you are truly looking for valid input on your punishment.
Edit: 
It looks like you added a pastebin of the other games after the fact but did not update the post text.

2. You have previously had a 10-game chat restriction, a 25-game chat restriction, and a 14-day ban in a short period of time. This means the next punishment of any type would result in a perma-ban.

> It seems the majority of people think this punishment is too harsh, although a punishment was needed

If you agree with this, then based upon escalation, the perma-ban should be the expected result.

If you feel your ban is unjustified, you can open a player support ticket and they will review that case manually.

I'm not passing any opinion on your case; I haven't read through all of the logs, etc. I just wanted to give a few pieces of information that may be relevant.

I honestly hopes he starts another account because I don't want to lose a player like him. I personally will create a smurf and play with him. If that prevents him from quitting. Like I said I don't know him at all. Also you look at presence not past when deciding a ban. 


I highly doubt your going to respond to this ,but have a great day :)
Will I get downvoted? Probs ,but I hope not because Im voicing my opinion. 

Up for some games anyone? Add me.
P.S. I love Riot Games. Thank you for making a game that I enjoyed for 6 years.

>I might have been annoying, but that is hardly reason to boot me from the game.

You were more than annoying and you did it MANY times despite repeated warnings through the punishment escalation system. That IS reason to boot you from the game.

> [{quoted}](name=Cosnirak,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3BP5Y1pp,comment-id=00570002000100010000,timestamp=2016-08-04T02:27:31.479+0000)

I don't understand why you're trying to use this portion of the chat log to justify my ban, it simply isn't going to work. There is nothing toxic in the snippet you provided aside from threatening to leave, which I would never go through with, and when players are already doing stupid things and refusing to communicate, I have to use a last resort. There is no other way to get people to listen in a fast paced game, you exhaust all your options and hope they stick.

As for the yelling is toxic, I did not yell. Yelling is emphasis of speech, caps is emphasis of typing. I'm emphasizing what I'm saying so it doesn't get lost in the rest of the idiocy being spewed into chat. I need my team to teamfight, I need them to focus on our one and only win condition ASAP before our window is up and we lose. If there was voice chat, this would be so much easier, but there isn't. Typing is my only option. You will find few truly toxic messages in my chat logs, far too little to justify a permanent suspension. And if I refine my use of chat to not include these messages, my shotcalling will be in a perfect spot.

>There is nothing toxic in the snippet you provided aside from threatening to leave, which I would never go through with, and when players are already doing stupid things and refusing to communicate, I have to use a last resort.

You NEVER have to use it, first resort or last. It is always toxic, NOTHING excuses it. It's that simple.

>There is no other way to get people to listen in a fast paced game, you exhaust all your options and hope they stick.

It isn't your job to get them to listen. Sometimes they just aren't going to. Your job is to accept that. That's the part you don't understand, winning is less important than being a good person, even in ranked games of League.

>As for the yelling is toxic, I did not yell.

On the internet using all caps is considered yelling by the majority (at least in NA). Agree with it or not, that's how it is as it relates to the rules of behavior in League.

> [{quoted}](name=Cosnirak,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3BP5Y1pp,comment-id=0057000200010001000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-04T04:24:49.804+0000)

> 
> It isn't your job to get them to listen. Sometimes they just aren't going to. Your job is to accept that. That's the part you don't understand, winning is less important than being a good person, even in ranked games of League.

Competitive League is about winning, nothing else. It is my obligation to my teammates to do everything I can to win the game with them, and that includes leading them when they are lost and shotcalling when no one else will. My job is to do everything I am capable of to win, and anything less belongs in a casual game mode. End of story. 
 
> On the internet using call caps is considered yelling by the majority (at least in NA). Agree with it or not, that's how it is as it relates to the rules of behavior in League.

If a player is going to be immature and mess with people, same as in the real world, they need to expect backlash and anger. Backlash is generally not okay, but it is expected and understood to be a direct product of being messed with. Caps, or yelling if that's what you choose to call it, is the absolute minimum and acceptable form of backlash to someone who is messing with you. And if you're insinuating that yelling is in violation of the rules then you need you're too far gone to reason with because that is just ridiculous.

>Competitive League is about winning, nothing else. It is my obligation to my teammates to do everything I can to win the game with them, and that includes leading them when they are lost and shotcalling when no one else will.

You're simply wrong here, sorry. Not even the LCS puts winning above all else. LCS players have been banned for toxicity as well. Even the Olympics has strong limitations on the attitudes and actions of competitors.

>Caps, or yelling if that's what you choose to call it, is the absolute minimum and acceptable form of backlash to someone who is messing with you.

It is neither the minimum nor accepted.

>And if you're insinuating that yelling is in violation of the rules then you need you're too far gone to reason with because that is just ridiculous.

I'm not insinuating anything, I'm directly saying it.

Sure a little yelling now and then can be forgiven. Also, if it's done in generally accepted good humor, it's fine. But when you're angrily yelling at people it's not ok. Sure one or two incidents of just that aren't major and therefor shouldn't (and won't) get someone penalized. But it is one more way people can be toxic and can contribute towards receiving a punishment. Doing it excessively absolutely warrants punishment. You did that.

> [{quoted}](name=Cosnirak,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3BP5Y1pp,comment-id=005700020001000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-08-04T04:50:40.187+0000)
>
> You're simply wrong here, sorry. Not even the LCS puts winning above all else. LCS players have been banned for toxicity as well. Even the Olympics has strong limitations on the attitudes and actions of competitors.

In the LCS and the olympics, players don't give up, rage quit, and flame eachother without cause. I was not toxic in any of my games until I was trolled.

> It is neither the minimum nor accepted.
> I'm not insinuating anything, I'm directly saying it.

Caps is accepted, I have never reported someone over using caps... What even is this argument? Since the summoners code seems to be the bible of behavior here, please show me a rule that insinuates caps would be considered inappropriate. I can't seem to find one.

> Sure a little yelling now and then can be forgiven. Also, if it's done in generally accepted good humor, it's fine. But when you're angrily yelling at people it's not ok. Sure one or two incidents of just that aren't major and therefor shouldn't (and won't) get someone penalized. But it is one more way people can be toxic and can contribute towards receiving a punishment. Doing it excessively absolutely warrants punishment. You did that.

But yelling is not acceptable. And neither is toxicity. So could I use this argument to say a little toxicity is acceptable? What about the large amount of messages I sent in those chat logs that were meant in good humor and/or banter with the enemy team? Surely those should be acceptable as they were not toxic and only appear toxic out of context.

>In the LCS and the olympics, players don't give up, rage quit, and flame eachother without cause.

While rare, they actually do some times. Just because you don't see it doesn't mean it doesn't happen. But most professionals know that such actions won't help them win, so they rise above and behave like they (and you) should. That's part of what separates them from the rest.

>Caps is accepted, I have never reported someone over using caps... What even is this argument?

You not reporting someone for an action does not make that action ok. To even imply that it does is silly at best.

>Since the summoners code seems to be the bible of behavior here, please show me a rule that insinuates caps would be considered inappropriate. I can't seem to find one.

Look harder, I'm not doing it for you.

>But yelling is not acceptable. And neither is toxicity. So could I use this argument to say a little toxicity is acceptable?

Absolutely! As Riot has made clear numerous times, we all have bad days, off games, and sometimes we're just human and mess up. That's why players don't get banned (or even punished at all usually) for one small offense. But if you demonstrate a pattern of such behavior, that isn't acceptable. That's what you did.

>What about the large amount of messages I sent in those chat logs that were meant in good humor and/or banter with the enemy team?

Not being toxic ALL of the time doesn't excuse a repeated pattern of toxic behavior.

They waste so much of my time while I'm trying to have good, positive games and climb the ladder. Unfortunately, because I shotcall a lot using chat and pings, I stand out and receive a lot more reports than most players would, whether it's from my reactionary flame or out of spite from making bad calls.
You're right to be mad at people who ruin your games. I think you riot should review your case
being held hostage by your teammates in a 3/2 vote for a lost game is the most toxic situation i have ever been in.

> [{quoted}](name=TASTE MY DUST,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3BP5Y1pp,comment-id=000a,timestamp=2016-08-03T08:29:35.441+0000)

It really is, mostly when there is already toxicity involved and players have given up. I have games where I vote yes, and all 4 teammates have given up and/or afkd, yet the vote goes 3/2. Just what.

People have differing definitions of "lost game". For most people, it's when the enemy gets first blood (which is sad). But I have a hard time seeing how trying to win a game, even when far behind is "toxic", and more importantly, how lashing out helps anything.

> [{quoted}](name=Mr Fidori,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3BP5Y1pp,comment-id=000a0001,timestamp=2016-08-03T13:11:28.895+0000)

The point is, they are not trying to win a game. In game 1 my adc and top went afk and just cleared minion waves until we surrendered. In game 3 my entire team got smashed and my top lane went afk. Both of these games were lost games, yet it took until 28 minutes to surrender both of them. The surrender votes were stuck 3/2 everytime, yet no one except me was trying to win and everyone was being toxic and flaming me, it feels like I'm being held hostage.

Hmm. Well it is possible that some of your teammates thought they were trying to win, and just not doing well at it. Which sucks. But I dunno if there's ever justification for having to say the words "I'm not toxic unless...". 

It sucks, because based on these 3 games alone, it doesn't warrant a perm ban, but there were other punishments before, and it takes effort to get to the point of a perma ban. I know you said you'd been better since the last one, but (and this part is on Riot) with how the system works, if you're already one step away from perma ban, it's not enough to be less toxic, you almost have to be free of reportable offenses altogether.

Anyway, you do seem like a pretty chill dude though outside of game, and I hope you continue to play (I think I saw somewhere that this was just on a smurf?).

> [{quoted}](name=Mr Fidori,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=3BP5Y1pp,comment-id=000a000100000000,timestamp=2016-08-03T13:29:04.458+0000)
>
> Hmm. Well it is possible that some of your teammates thought they were trying to win, and just not doing well at it. Which sucks. But I dunno if there's ever justification for having to say the words "I'm not toxic unless...". 
> 
> It sucks, because based on these 3 games alone, it doesn't warrant a perm ban, but there were other punishments before, and it takes effort to get to the point of a perma ban. I know you said you'd been better since the last one, but (and this part is on Riot) with how the system works, if you're already one step away from perma ban, it's not enough to be less toxic, you almost have to be free of reportable offenses altogether.
> 
> Anyway, you do seem like a pretty chill dude though outside of game, and I hope you continue to play (I think I saw somewhere that this was just on a smurf?).

I can tell when teammates are trying to win and not, and in the example games given in my chat logs, some of my teammates who gave up let everyone know in chat. My comms just need to not include the toxicity towards trolls, and I now realize how bad it looked. It's just sickening to know how easily they get off without punishment when all it takes is a cocky one-liner with trigger words to set off the report system. And like I said in previous comments, even when I don't flame at trolls, I still get a good number of reports. People naturally don't like when someone takes charge when that someone is a stranger who may not even be doing well himself. 

I will be queueing on a smurf, but I will have to climb the ladder again, ruining 100+ games along the way because there is less than 10% chance I will lose any game below diamond. I just want to bring awareness to this issue, the system is broken and the "solution" causes a lot more harm than good.
Well, thanks for your attempt to bring this to light, cause you're right -- it's definitely not an efficient system all the time. Fast climbing ahead, friend!

you don't get permabanned for one infraction. I agree that what you have posted is acceptable and not really bannable behavior, but I can't advise you based off of it because a permanent ban would be a result of consistent reports, or cheating.

Not the worst I've seen but I'll say this:  You type too much.

If you would have kept if clear, concise and polite you'd still have your account. When calls are ignored time and time again in a relatively high elo ranked game, there is reason to be upset. It's so incredibly frustrating when my teammates immediately ff at 20 with a late game composition, or when they afk and mentally check out before the game is even close to determined. It's apparent in people's decision making and macro play when they are tilted and/or mentally checked out of the game. 

I believe that only game 2, given the context of the chat, is over the top and toxic to the team, but when put in context of the way the game is playing out, it's rather obvious why the chat escalated to that level. I chose to put my cards in that of my top/mid/ad carries and take on the role of tank/cc jungler. After a successful early and mid game, my solo laners made the choice to completely ignore the game plan and make the same mistakes over and over again. They became tilted, toxic, and unfocused. The game was over before it even began for our composition, because my teammates didn't have the mental fortitude to rally behind their shotcaller and push it to a win. 

There is simply no excuse for weak mindedness in ranked. I realize I shouldn't include the you suck messages and such, but when players agree to a game plan and do the exact opposite 15 seconds later, they're trolling. That being said, this is why we need an option to disable chat. There is simply no reason why a player like me should be permanently removed from the game over this kind of chat, while afks go unnoticed and unpunished.
